problem_text: Use Poiseuille’s law to calculate the pressure drop (P) when: Q = 2×10⁻⁶ m³/s, radius H = 0.002 m, length L = 0.05 m, and viscosity μ = 0.004 Pa·s.
solution_text: Use R = (8μL)/(πH⁴) and then P = QR. Final pressure drop ≈ 40 Pa.

problem_text: What role does the balloon play in the garden sprayer demonstration of the Windkessel effect?
solution_text: It mimics the compliant aorta: smoothing sharp bursts into continuous flow.

problem_text: Compare the electrical equation C(dV/dt) + V/R = I to the circulatory equation C(dP/dt) + P/R = Q. Match each term.
solution_text: V ↔ P, I ↔ Q, C and R are direct analogues (capacitance and compliance, resistance).

problem_text: Why does a loss of compliance in arteries lead to greater strain on the heart?
solution_text: Stiffer arteries can’t absorb pressure, leading to higher peak loads and cardiovascular stress.
